description.p: “Felis are the kindest, and most adorable stranglers I have ever met. If it were not for their love of sunbathing I fear they would have turned to conquest; and I find myself wondering if the world is worse for it”

All Felis share a love of exploring - their curiosity of the world is what drives them onwards. They are constantly looking for new technologies, spells, and rare legendary items to further their clan's honor. Felis are strong dexterous race only stopped by their own shortcomings.
Felis Names:(Male) Anton (Female) Claudia; (Clan name) Cerulean, Claw, Maine, White Paw, Shadow, Forest, Chant, Hex, Iron Tooth
Your Felis character will share a few common traits and attributes with all other Felis
Ability Score Increase. Your Charisma and Dexterity score increases by 2.
Age. Felis are considered full adults when the reach the age of 13.
Alignment. The majority of Felis are neutral and lean towards being adventures or quest seekers. A Felis will always inspect the interesting and discover out the unknown.
Size. Felis average between 2-3 feet tall and weigh up to 60 pounds. Your size is Small.
Speed. Your base walking speed is 25 feet.
Claws. Due to your claws you have a climb speed of 15 feet. You can also use your claws as a weapon. When you land an attack you deal 1d4 + Strength modifier as slashing damage as an unarmed attack.
Felis Lineage. Choose one of the lineages. Your lineage determines your Felis Favor.

Darkvision. Accustomed to the night, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
Purrsuasion Felis use their short and cute nature to their advantage as much as they can. You have proficiency in the Persuasion skill.
Curious Nature Being an inquisitive Felis you have proficiency in the Investigation skill.
Nine Lives You can fail 9 death saves before you die, instead of 3. Additionally you regain 1 hit point on a natural 19 when rolling death saves.
Ride. You can get on the back of any Party member taller than 6.5 feet and ride them, reducing your damage to 1d6.
Languages. You can speak, read, and write Common and Sylvan.
Tabby Felis are among the most common of all the lineages. As such they know more about common social spheres. You increase your Wisdom score by 1.

Fur pure as the whitest snow, those Felis born without color are often seen as the noblest of the Felis. When of age they take up leadership roles in their clans. Once per long rest you can instill allies with a sense of vigor. Those within a 15 foot range of you gain temporary health equal to your Charisma modifier for 8 hours.
Hot tempered and quick to lash out with claws, these ginger furred Felis are furious in the field of battle. Increase your Strength score by 1.
Masters of tracking, those with brown fur are destined to hunt. You gain proficence in the Survival skill.

Calico fur is the rarest of all Felis lineages. The legends say that all of the black furred Felis' luck went to the calico. Once per day when you roll an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw you can choose to reroll. You must accept the results of the reroll.
Starry eyed and fur of a blue-night sky it is said that these Felis are connected to the Astral Sea. Increase your intelligence by 1.
Grey is the purrfect color for being able to blend into things. Felis with grey fur are able to hide very easily. you gain proficency in the Stealth skill.

Typically those born of this lineage are of pure black fur and carry a natural unluckiness where ever they go. Once per long rest as a reaction you cast your bad luck onto an enemy giving them disadvantage on one attack or ability saving throw.
You have a climbing speed of 15 feet. To use this speed, you can’t be wearing heavy armor.
